source.title: Dithermark GitHub Page
source.description: the complete source code for Dithermark

source.title: Image Dithering: Eleven Algorithms and Source Code
source.description: the article that served as the original inspiration for Dithermark

source.title: DITHER.TXT
source.description: one of the orginal references for image dithering

source.title: Libcaca study: the science behind colour ASCII art
source.description: very thorough series of chapters on different aspects of dithering, including lesser known variations on ordered and error diffusion dithering. Also is the source for the halftone ordered dither pattern.

source.title: a dither
source.description: the basis for the arithmetic dithers

source.title: FFmpeg CVS Commit: add two spatially stable dithering methods
source.description: Commit where a dither was integrated into FFmpeg with description of its advantages

source.title: Riemersma dither
source.description: Description of an original approach to error diffusion dithering using a Hilbert curve

source.title: This codegolf challenge to dither an image
source.description: had some interesting, original approaches

source.title: Artistic dithering with textures
source.description: describes converting a texture into dither matrix, as well as the Veryovka-Buchanan dithering method. Also contains an overview of other dithering methods.

source.title: OpenCV: Image Thresholding
source.description: compares adapting thresholding with classical threshold algorithm

source.title: Dither Stabilization
source.description: describes the creator of Return of the Obra Dinn's process for making an image dithering visual effect that would remain stable even when the player moves the camera

source.title: Wikipedia's ordered dither article
source.description: Good introduction to ordered dithering with Bayer matrix examples and formula. However, note that while the formula for the Bayer matrix is correct, the example for the 8×8 matrix is not, something that caused me many headaches.

source.title: Dithering on the GPU
source.description: the inspiration to port the dithers to WebGL, and the source for the hue-lightness dithering algorithm

source.title: Joel Yliluoma's arbitrary-palette positional dithering algorithm
source.description: a variation on ordered dithering specifically tuned to give better contrast and color fidelity than classical ordered dithering. Also the source for the Yliluoma 1 and Yliluoma 2 dithering algorithms.

source.title: This blog post from one of the developers of Uncharted 4
source.description: details how they used dithering to simulate semi-transparent foliage in front of the camera

source.title: Bayer Matrix creation function in Python
source.description: One of the only source code examples I could find for generating a Bayer matrix

source.title: University of Wisconsin Madison lecture (Power Point)
source.description: The basis for the clustered ordered dithering matrix

source.title: Clustered-dot-ordered Dither (Power Point)
source.description: Includes an example of the spiral ordered dithering matrix which has similar results to the cluster pattern. Also mentions digital halftoning.

source.title: Post Processing: Pixelation
source.description: An article about creative uses of pixelation

source.title: Wikipedia's article on color difference
source.description: Overview of the different ways colors can be compared

source.title: Seven grayscale conversion algorithms
source.description: interesting article about how something as seemingly as simple as converting an image into black and white is really not so simple. Also is the inpiration for the color dither 'Luma' color comparison algorithm

source.title: Color Cycling in Pixel Art
source.description: Good introduction to color cycling, why it was used, how it works and includes examples

source.title: Old School Color Cycling with HTML5
source.description: examples of Mark J. Ferrari's color cycling work

source.title: An Overview of Color Quantization Techniques
source.description: a good general overview

source.title: University of Wisconsin Madison lecture (Power Point)
source.description: show different color quantization algorithm's output differences. Also mentions clustered ordered dithering.

source.title: RgbQuant.js
source.description: the source for the RGB Quant algorithm.

source.title: A Simple Method for Color Quantization: Octree Quantization (PDF)
source.description: the original paper introducing octree quantization.

source.title: An Effective Color Quantization Method Using Octree-Based Self-Organizing Maps
source.description: a paper that describes using neural networks to improve octree color quantization

source.title: Octree color quantizer in Python
source.description: the basis for the octree optimize palette algorithm

source.title: Leptonica Color Quantization
source.description: describes their variations on median cut and octree color quantization.

source.title: scolorq: A Spatial Color Quantization Utility
source.description: an original color quantization algorithm and implementation in C++, specifically tuned for small output color palettes.

source.title: A Simple - Yet Quite Powerful - Palette Quantizer in C#
source.description: details an original color quantization algorithm and associated utility in C#. Also includes comparison with other color quantization methods, including some lesser known ones.

source.title: High quality GIF with FFmpeg (Hacker News comments)
source.description: fascinating discussion that includes several different color quantization recommendations

source.title: Optimizing canvas
source.description: I wasn't able to make use of any of these tips, but the article makes good points that should be kept in mind.

source.title: WebGL Fundamentals
source.description: a great resource for learning WebGL, this page on recreating DrawImage was used when implementing the dithers in WebGL

source.title: GLSL Data Types and Variables
source.description: the range of values for the different data types table ended up being very valuable for fixing some bugs caused by lower default precision on mobile devices.

source.title: WebGL GLSL built-in functions
source.description: a frequently consulted resource

source.title: WebGL Stats
source.description: the closest thing to Can I use… for WebGL support

source.title: Improvements to the canonical one-liner GLSL rand()
source.description: the source for the random function used in the WebGL dithers

source.title: WebGL Bitwise functions
source.description: the source for the bitwise functions used in the WebGL arithmetic dithers

source.title: glfx.js
source.description: A library of different image filter implemented in WebGL. The source for the denoise filter as well as the contrast algorithm used on Safari and Edge.

source.title: Made by Evan
source.description: cool WebGL projects

source.title: Non-linear filters & Image Compression (PDF)
source.description: Differences between median and bilateral filters (with image examples) as well as denoising in general

source.title: Smoothing Operations
source.description: Nice chart and image examples that show the differences between different linear and non-linear filters, as well as their time complexities.

source.title: OpenGL Kuwahara filter example
source.description: The source for the smoothing (Kuwahara filter) translated into WebGL.

source.title: Pixelator
source.description: desktop app specifically made to turn your photos into pixel art

source.title: Halftone Pro
source.description: cool web app that showcases halftoning, another type of dithering

source.title: webgl-filter
source.description: an in browser image editor that showcases the image filters in the glfx.js library.
